data.message: المشاريع نفسها git. مقدار التعاملات سواء في Issues و لا comments و لا أي حاجة تانية لا يقارن بعدد البوستات و الردود و الشير/ريتويت بتاع فيسبوك ولا تويتر. و برده روبي مش واقعة قوي قوي قوي يعني في الـ performance.

the problem for twitter is not a specific language. the problem in big social application is how to support that amount of concurrent users. which is normally a combination between the datacenter architect and how they will manage a load balancer and which programing language will help them to scale.
ruby is a very powerful language by the way the problem of performance comes from Rails.
That's what i'm telling you :D the problem is not ruby :D Rails is the one that has performance issues. if you try to make a ruby application with Sinatra you will know what i mean :D

Why they should use Scala? C++ is faster!

Performance & Scalability is a complex topic. It cannot be simplified as "Use Scala". Even though Twitter use it successfully, it's not the solution to every problem.

I will mention a personal war-story: we had a project in college where we could use one of two algorithms in Matlab. One of them is faster but uses more memory than the 2nd. I tried to run the faster one but it was very slow that my machine hanged for over 10m, then it failed. I tried the slower one & it finished in less than 2m like a charm.

Plus, performance & scalability are not the only factors.
Ruby is inspired from Python by the way :)

AFAIK, Twitters problems was mostly because of design than language. Also, each stage of a project life has different requirements. When they started Scala was still in its infancy.
